misdeed: Brutal murders plague a remote village, each victim seemingly torn apart by a wild animal. The killings coincide with the full moon, fueling rumors of a monstrous beast lurking in the shadows.
solution: The Vaesen is a Werewolf and can be killed by being struck with a silver weapon while Broken, freed from its curse by being called by its true name under the light of a full moon, or can break the curse itself by devouring a human baby.

clues.description: The villagers whisper of a curse, passed down through generations, that transforms a person into a bloodthirsty beast under the light of the full moon.
Tracks found near the crime scenes are a chilling mix of human and animal, suggesting a creature caught between two worlds.
Victims bear deep bite marks and claw wounds, far exceeding the capabilities of any known predator in the area.
A bloody scrap of cloth, identified as belonging to a reclusive villager, is found near the latest crime scene.
The air is thick with the scent of blood and musk, a primal fear gripping the hearts of the villagers as the full moon rises.
A local healer discovers a cache of strange herbs and animal bones hidden beneath the floorboards of the suspect's home.

plotTwist.description: The village priest, harboring a dark secret, is the true source of the curse, having made a pact with dark forces to gain power and influence over his flock.
